General information.Content: This database contains data from international key comparisons for radionuclide metrology since the inception of the international system of reference (SIR) for radionuclide metrology at the BIPM in 1976.

References.[1]: Romain Coulon et al 2022 Meas. Sci. Technol. 33 024003 - https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-6501/ac3fc4

Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cd-109(200.Reference of the published comparison re: Ratel G., Michotte C., BIPM comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cd-109 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{109}$Cd and links for the 1986 international comparison CCRI(II)-K2.Cd-109, \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/40/1A/06019}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2003, \textbf{40}, Tech. Suppl., 06019}

Ratel G., Michotte C., Janssen, Kossert K., Lucas L. and Karam L.,Activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{109}$Cd for the PTB, Germany and the NIST, USA in the ongoing comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cd-109, \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/42/1A/06011}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2005, \textbf{42}, Tech. Suppl., 06011}

Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cd-109(202.Reference of the published comparison re: Michotte C., Courte S., Nonis M., Coulon R., Judge S., Ratel G., Fr\'echou C. and Thiam C., Update of the BIPM comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cd-109 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{109}$Cd to include the 2012 result of the LNE-LNHB (France), \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/58/1A/06026}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2021, \textbf{58}, Tech. Suppl., 06026}

Data from AECL-1982.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Laboratory.Full name: Bureau International des Poids et Mesures
Laboratory.Address: Pavillon de Breteuil, F-92312 Sèvres Cedex

Data from BIPM-1986.Comments on impurities contained into th: ampoules measured by the BIPM in the frame of the 1986 CCRI(II)-K2.Cd-109 and used to make the link for the CCRI(II) key comparison
Data from BIPM-1986.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Data from CMI-IIR-1978.Comments on the equivalent activity: Result not included in  the KCRV because of potential impurity in the solution (see details in~\cite{KCRV_2003}.) and activity in the ampoule significantly lower than the minimum required for the SIR (45 MBq)
Data from CMI-IIR-1978.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Data from CMI-IIR-1986.Comments on the equivalent activity: Result not included in  the KCRV because of potential impurity in the solution (see details in~\cite{KCRV_2003}.)
Data from CMI-IIR-1986.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Data from IRA-2000.Comment(s) on the measurement method(s): calibrated in 1986 against 4pi(NaI(Tl))gamma counting and 4pi(LS)ce counting in the frame of the CCRI(II) comparison
Data from IRA-2000.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Laboratory.Full name: Université Paris-Saclay, CEA, List, Laboratoire National Henri Becquerel

Data from LNE-LNHB-1980.Comments on the SIR measurement: the SIR uncertainty reflects the uncertainties of the impurity measurements reported by the NMI
Data from LNE-LNHB-1980.Comments on the equivalent activity: Activity in the ampoule significantly lower than the minimum required for the SIR (45 MBq)
Data from LNE-LNHB-1980.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Laboratory.Full name: Université Paris-Saclay, CEA, List, Laboratoire National Henri Becquerel

Data from LNE-LNHB-1998.Particularities of the submission to the: 1 sample and average of several measurement methods
Data from LNE-LNHB-1998.Comments on the equivalent activity: Activity in the ampoule significantly lower than the minimum required for the SIR (45 MBq) and therefore not included in the calculation of the KCRV
Data from LNE-LNHB-1998.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Laboratory.Full name: Université Paris-Saclay, CEA, List, Laboratoire National Henri Becquerel

Data from LNE-LNHB-2012.Contributor(s) from the BIPM: C.~Michotte, S.~Courte, M.~Nonis, R.~Coulon, S.~Judge, G.~Ratel
Data from LNE-LNHB-2012.Comments on the equivalent activity: Activity in the ampoule significantly lower than the minimum required for the SIR (45 MBq) and therefore not included in the calculation of the KCRV
Data from LNE-LNHB-2012.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Laboratory.Full name: National Institute of Standards and Technology
Laboratory.Address: 100 Bureau Drive, Mail Stop 8462 MD 20899-8462 Gaithersburg

Data from NIST-2004.Comment(s) on the measurement method(s): calibrated in 1986 against 4pi(NaI(Tl))gamma counting and 4pi(LS)ce counting in the frame of the CCRI(II) comparison
Data from NIST-2004.Comments on the equivalent activity: Result not included in the KCRV because of the slow drift of the ampoule holder's height in the IC at the NIST discovered in 2012
Data from NIST-2004.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Data from NMIJ-1996.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Laboratory.Full name: National Metrology Institute of South Africa
Laboratory.Address: National Metrology Institute of South Africa (NMISA), Cape Town

Data from NMISA-1978.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Laboratory.Full name: National Metrology Institute of South Africa
Laboratory.Address: National Metrology Institute of South Africa (NMISA), Cape Town

Data from NMISA-1979.Particularities of the submission to the: Several samples and several measurement methods
Data from NMISA-1979.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Laboratory.Full name: National Metrology Institute of South Africa
Laboratory.Address: National Metrology Institute of South Africa (NMISA), Cape Town

Data from NMISA-1981.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Laboratory.Full name: National Metrology Institute of South Africa
Laboratory.Address: National Metrology Institute of South Africa (NMISA), Cape Town

Data from NMISA-1982.Comments on the SIR measurement: changed from 14 x $10^{-4}$ to 20 x $10^{-4}$ and 21 x $10^{-4}$ due to the density effect in the SIR at low energy~\cite{Metrologia2017_06010}
Data from NMISA-1982.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Data from NPL-1980.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Data from PTB-1994.Comments on the equivalent activity: Activity in the ampoule significantly lower than the minimum required for the SIR (45 MBq)
Data from PTB-1994.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Data from PTB-2004.Comment(s) on the measurement method(s): calibrated in March 2005 by a combination of 4pi(PPC)ce counting 4P-PP-CE-00-00-HE, LS counting 4P-LS-CE-00-00-00 and HPGe spectrometry UA-GH-GR-00-00-00
Data from PTB-2004.Reference for the decay data used by the: {B}\' {e} {M.-M.}, {C}hist\'{e} {V}., {D}ulieu {C}., {B}rowne {E}., {C}hechev {V}., {K}uzmenko {N}., {H}elmer {R}.,   {N}ichols  {A.},  {S}ch\"{o}nfeld  { E}.,   {D}ersch   {R}., \href{http://www.bipm.org/utils/common/pdf/monographieRI/Monographie_BIPM-5_Tables_Vol2.pdf}{\textit{Table   of   radionuclides}, Monographie BIPM-5, 2004, Vol 2}.
Data from PTB-2004.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1
